title: Black and Blue, review: Naomie Harris proves she needs no help from Bond
text:
15 cert, 108 min. Dir: Deon Taylor. Starring: Naomie Harris, Tyrese Gibson, Frank Grillo, Reid Scott, Mike Colter, Beau Knapp

The cop thriller Black and Blue is just the ticket for Naomie Harris, if she wants to prove she can shoulder a suspenseful action flick by looking sharp, acting credibly nervy, and keeping us squarely on her side. The timing is right, too. There’s talk of a Moneypenny spin-off from the Bond series – Barry Jenkins, who directed Harris to an Oscar nomination in Moonlight, is game for doing it. In truth, Harris is way better in Black and Blue than she has been to date as a mere sidekick in the world of 007.

This New Orleans-set policier – from the writer of Flightplan, Peter...
